p:
The effects of the sexual force of infection in terms of how effective the sexual transmission is in the post-viremic stage (
K L
) can be seen in Figure 3. The extra source of risk to women, associated with transmission from infectious men (both acute and latent), is evident as well in Figure 5, which makes it clear that in the presence of sexual transmission,
Î² s
> 0
, attack ratios for women will always be greater than for men.
